article.headline: Saint Louis 67, Pacific 60
article.story: STOCKTON, Calif. (AP) -- Tommie Liddell and Ian Vouyoukas each scored 17 points as Saint Louis rallied from an 11-point halftime deficit to beat Pacific 67-60 Tuesday night. Kevin Lisch had 16 points and seven assists for the Billikens, who outscored Pacific 10-2 to end the game. Saint Louis (7-2) limited Pacific to just 16 points in the second half. Steffan Johnson scored 18 points for Pacific (3-7), which made just 5 of 25 field-goal attempts in the second half after shooting 59 percent from the field in the first half. Anthony Brown added 13 points and Solomon Horse Chief had 10 for the Tigers, who lost their fourth consecutive game. Pacific held a 46-35 lead two minutes into the second half, but Saint Louis soon erased that advantage. The lead changed hands seven times before the Billikens' game-ending run. Saint Louis made its first three shots and remained hot early, but Johnson scored Pacific's first 14 points to keep the Tigers close. Johnson did all his scoring in the first half, making each of his seven field-goal attempts. There were nine lead changes in the first half before Pacific went on a 15-2 run to take command. The Tigers then got 3-pointers from Horse Chief and Reggie Vezia in the final minute before halftime to take a 44-33 lead at the break. After Vezia's basket early in the second half restored Pacific's 11-point advantage, the Tigers scored just one point over the next 7:33 to allow the Billikens to chip away at that lead.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
